results.title: Growth/Demand Generation Manager
results.description:
At Eppo, we are building the future of AB experimentation, so that every company can have an entrepreneurial, customer oriented culture. We dramatically lower the overhead of running experiments by automating all of the experiment operations work that typically get pushed to analytics teams, and wrapping the results in collaborative workflows that give confidence in the results.

 

About the Role

We are hiring a Demand Generation Manager to partner closely with our Head of Product and Content Marketing. In this role you will be responsible for creating, executing, managing and optimizing our growth strategy. You will have a deep understanding of our audiences, and be able to look through data to determine direction and opportunities.

 

Your Background

This individual understands today’s MarTech ecosystem deeply, and has experience marketing tools to technical audiences. This individual has spent time in the marketing space and has a deep understanding of demand generation and growth for start-ups. Knowledge with data science and experimentation is a plus.

Attributes

  • Business owner mindset: you are comfortable making choices in ambiguous situations, and think of the team's success and failure as your own.

  • Organized: you have an appetite for organization and managing multiple workflows.

  • Communicator: you can communicate with stakeholders and customers and understand how to adjust to different ways of communication.

  • Curiosity: You are a lifelong learner, and are obsessed with understanding why customers act the way they do.

Skills

  • Facilitate and promote customer webinars and events to drive lead generation

  • Develop and execute multi-channel campaigns

  • Create and maintain lead and pipeline metrics (data collection, lead scoring, and analytics)

  • Create customer personas and gain a deep understanding of their buying persona

  • Strategize nurture campaigns to target consumers for various stages of the sales lifecycle

  • A growth mindset and strong accountability mentality

  • Exceptional verbal and written communication skills

  • Expertise and organizational management skills to onboard vendors/contractors as needed

 

Compensation

  • Competitive salary and equity

  • Top of the line health, dental, and vision insurance

  • New laptop/equipment of your choice and whatever else you need to be productive

  • Compensation for learning materials, tools, and resources to help you learn and grow

results.title: Content Marketing Manager (Fintech)
results.description:
Solidgate is a B2B product in the field of online payments. We build “made in Ukraine” fintech solutions that help businesses accept payments and ensure a smooth purchase experience for their clients from Europe to LATAM, from the USA to Asia. We are part of the history of each company we work with — and we help them enter new markets and increase their profits. We believe no company should struggle with payments. So we make them easy.

Solidgate achievements:

  • offices in Ukraine, Poland, Cyprus
  • 200+ clients went global thanks to Solidgate (Ukraine, US, EU)
  • 100+ alternative payment methods (APMs)
  • 120 team members
  • PCI DSS Level 1 provider
  • № 1 employer (Ukrainian DOU version)

We're looking for a Content Marketing Manager who can help us tell the story of how the Solidgate product enables global businesses and builds the economic infrastructure for the internet economy. You will give a voice to our company over a range of channels and experiences and share knowledge about payments and technology across the industry.

Our advantages:

  • Fintech — fast-growing industry
  • Back-end driven product with complex logic, architecture, and modern stack (Golang, Java, Kotlin, React, Typescript, PostgreSQL, Elastic, Redis, RabbitMQ, Docker, AWS)
  • the opportunity to do business with large Western tech companies (USA, Europe)
  • challenges and direct impact on business scaling, on product metrics, here you can propose and implement
  • a team that burns with a common goal, has a common vision and values
  • opportunity for development and growth, personal career plan for each employee

You will:

  • interpret directive and technical information and turn it into creative and engaging copy for intended readers to build the case that Solidgate is the best payments solution for all of our target audience segments;
  • conduct in-depth research on industry-related topics in order to develop original content;
  • create content for Solidgate Blog (articles, news, lead magnets, etc.);
  • apply insights from user research to guide your ideas, and validate your solutions with user testing and analytics that help Solidgate stand out from the noise and engage new users otherwise wouldn't have reached.

You should have:

  • 3+ years experience in content marketing/ developing business content in the IT-sphere (fintech is a great plus);
  • pro of simple, concise and language as well as growth marketing copywriting best practices;
  • experience working on digital marketing collateral (Email, Facebook Ads, etc.);
  • creative mindset and strong communication skills;
  • deep understanding of the product development process;
  • basic understanding of SEO;
  • Advanced level of English (C1/C2).

​​Keep in mind, this is not only about writing text, it's also about metrics and promotion!

Feels like a perfect match already? Get in contact with us on LinkedIn:

Recruiter, Tania Baladynska / Telegram

Competitive corporate benefits:

  • health insurance and corporate doctor
  • free lunches in the office
  • full coverage of professional training (courses, meetups, certifications)
  • performance review twice a year
  • sports compensation
  • competitive salary
  • the ability to work remotely
  • Apple equipment
Hiring process:

Screening with a recruiter, an interview with a hiring manager, a test task and a final interview with the CEO.

If you want to become part of our team, send your resume right now and we will contact you.

results.title: Director of Demand Generation
results.description:
To Apply:

Please submit your application here https://hire.toggl.com/c/pq0v2/7vgjl/

  • Type: Contractor (full-time)
  • Work place: Anywhere (remote). This role will require you to work primarily during Eastern Time (GMT-4).
  • Compensation: $2,500-3,500 USD/month

About You

You are a strategic, visionary and hands-on Marketing Leader, with the ability to define and execute demand-generating strategies for a fast-growing company, while building a highly accountable team that sets targets and hits them consistently. You live, breathe, love and understand demand generation marketing for enterprise for a SaaS B2B platform. This role reports to the CEO and is a member of the leadership team.

Your Impact

  • Identify and fix holes in our sales funnel.
  • Develop compelling multi-channel marketing programs to support the demand generation needs of the sales team so they can consistently hit their SQL targets.
  • Work with the marketing team to develop, execute, promote and produce strong content-driven campaigns that resonate with our audience and help build awareness of our brand and product category.
  • Constantly test and analyze new marketing initiatives for continuous improvement.
  • Regularly analyze marketing and sales funnel data to optimize and focus marketing efforts on leads that drive the maximum sales results.
  • Manage all marketing contact lists and establish deep knowledge of our database of marketing leads to uncover where opportunities for engagement exist to generate qualified interest
  • Understand the needs of our target audience, and translate those needs into creative and personalized marketing programs

Our company

V2 Cloud is a fast growing tech company. We help businesses embrace remote work by providing a fully managed Desktop-as-a-Service solution from the Cloud. We are a young and dynamic team with an awesome product that serves over 900 clients and 35,000 users worldwide. More information at www.v2cloud.com

Our Vision is to "Help businesses create workplaces where people love to work."

Mission: "Create the best remote work experience for people and companies."

Our Values:

  • We enjoy our work, take pride in exceeding expectations and a job well done.
  • We get stuff done.
  • Keep It Simple & Smart
  • Life is too short to work with A**holes

We hire the people we trust, and we trust the people we hire. We value diversity of thought - Be bold enough to voice dissenting opinions.

Requirements

You will be measured on:

  • Revenue generation
  • Inbound opportunity creation
  • New user acquisition
  • Conversions and retention all the way through the flywheel
  • A mix of marketing, sales, and product qualified opportunities

What will you need?

  • Demonstrated experience of leading marketing teams and track-record of driving user growth at a B2B tech platform.
  • You have a proven track record of generating leads and pipeline via strategic digital marketing initiatives.
  • Comfortable owning the full marketing stack across product marketing, brand marketing, demand generation, content marketing, communications, and PR strategy.
  • Demonstrated ability in developing and executing GTM campaigns which are measurable, scalable, and cost-effective.
  • Expert analytical and quantitative skills with demonstrated ability to analyze data and translate to actionable changes and a history of demonstrating results via data-driven marketing campaigns.
  • Deep understanding of the SaaS B2B marketing environment and evolving tools/platforms used to improve online presence
  • Hands-on experience with CRM and SEO tools like Google Analytics, Google Adwords, Pardot, Hubspot, etc

If this sounds exciting, we'd love to hear from you! Not sure you’re a perfect fit? Reach out anyway. We’re looking for awesome individuals, not folks who perfectly match a job posting.

results.title: Product Marketing Manager
results.description:
Keboola is a versatile data operating system that enables companies to automate business actions using data and produce value. It is also flexible enough to be deployed in big enterprise stacks, thereby helping data teams work faster and smarter. Keboola lowers the barrier to entry for aspiring data teams and helps increase the productivity of data teams by reducing the complexity of the data stack, design, operation and maintenance. This leads to a better focus on the actual business value. 
 
Keboola’s success is built by innovation, and our remote-mainly team spread across offices in Prague, Vancouver, Chicago, greater Europe, and beyond. We believe that when people have a mission and a voice, their well-being and performance is better. Our environment stands for no BS and grants our people the ability to interact freely across teams connected by a passion for a culture of continuous learning while encompassing care, love, and respect. 
 
This position is best-suited for an experienced product marketer, who knows how to get shit done. Someone who is proactive, detail oriented and data-driven.
 
Regardless of the specifics of your background, you should be able to demonstrate:
-Consulting skills demonstrated by the ability to break down complex problems into pieces in an orderly way, understand their intricacies, and define a solution that your stakeholders will understand and want to adopt.
-Communication skills that include professional English and the skills to remain calm in a heated situation and focus on achieving an outcome that works for all parties involved.
-Problem-solving and analytical skills across a wide array of tools. You can easily switch between brainstorming a process improvement on a whiteboard and developing a weighted-average cash-in prediction model.



What you'll do
  • Support and activate global go-to-market strategies for new and updated product releases including internal and external collateral development, sales training, customer communication and messaging.
  • Develop and deliver end-to-end integrated go-to-market & communications plans for product launches.
  • Work closely with product and Dev teams to guide strategy, timing of launch, target audience and local needs, and the launch communication and success criteria.
  • Design and improve processes that will help us scale activities across the region while reflecting local specifics.
  • Develop customer campaigns to optimize adoption of current and new features, in partnership with the Product team. 
  • Be the owner of all product marketing content, such as product documentation, videos, webinars, presentations, sales sheets and blog posts.
  • Work with the Sales and Product team on creation of product training and product enablement materials.



The skills and experience you need to have
  • 5+ years of experience working in technology field, preferably SaaS
  • Proven experience on a similar role
  • Data-oriented person
  • Used to collaborating with teams across the company
  • Passionate about technology
  • Fluent in English



A little bit more about the opportunity
  • Autonomy within your position. We are focused on outcomes, not micromanaging everything that you do. We love free company movement.
  • Work with great brands both locally and worldwide. Ask us who we are working with!
  • Work with new industry-leading data technologies.
  • The opportunity to create the job you want that fits in with the life you want. We know there is life outside of work, and think fulfillment is achieved when all areas of your life fit together.
  • We believe the best people are a bit weird and have an inner engine that drives them. 



You can look forward to the following benefits
  • Competitive compensation, bonuses and Stock options.
  • Generous paid vacation time.  And we mean generous.
  • Cool new offices in the heart of Holesovice in Prague.
  • We are a company born in the cloud means we are relatively location independent. Want to take an extra-long trip while working on the beach (or forest, or desert?), go ahead - make sure to send us a postcard. 
  • No set office hours and flexible work environment.
Keboola’s Philosophies and Values
CARE, LOVE AND RESPECT
CREATE AND INNOVATE
GET YOUR STUFF DONE
LEARN
ONE TEAM
NO BULLSHIT
 
Come One, Come All
Keboola provides equal employment opportunities to all employees, consultants, and applicants for employment. We do not discriminate on any basis. Here’s the thing: we don’t care what color you are, who you pray to, what gender you identify with, if you have tattoos or your hair is blue. We hire based on skill and culture fit. It really is that simple.
 
More About Keboola
Every day Keboola connects data, systems, and people to do their best work all in one place. Keboola is a hybrid, multi-cloud data platform that reduces your day-to-day complexity with data by streamlining and automating your data processes and systems, creating a scalable data structure that works best for you, and aligns business and IT in a secure environment so they can do meaningful work together. Hundreds of innovative companies use Keboola to unlock their data-driven power. The company has offices in Chicago, Vancouver, London, and Prague. For more information, connect with us on LinkedIn, Twitter, Facebook or visit keboola.com.

results.title: Paid Social Media Strategist (Facebook/Instagram)
results.description:
The Strategist at JUICE is responsible for the health of the partnership and relationship for the client accounts in which they will serve as the primary POC. A Strategist will manage Senior Buyers and Buyers within their POD and be an individual who can strategize, executive, optimize, and drive performance in accounts.

 

About us:

JUICE is a digital growth & marketing agency founded by two entrepreneurs with successful previous exits. Our strict focus on maximizing ROI has helped our clients see enormous revenue-driving success across user acquisition, eCommerce, and lead generation campaigns. JUICE is an Inc. 5000 award-winning industry leader in results-driven growth strategy development, social advertising, search engine marketing, organic search ranking, and lead generation. JUICE focuses on building scalable, efficient campaigns that drive results.

 

What you’ll do:

  • Be the primary point of contact for the clients the strategist has been assigned to.
  • Strategize, execute, and manage a portfolio of client-paid social ad campaigns
  • Develop marketing strategies and create clear plans to achieve client business goals.
  • Design funnels with a thorough understanding of LTV and CAC, not just the initial acquisition of new customers/users.
  • Serve as a leader in the company by clearly communicating strategy, performance, and campaign recommendations externally and internally
  • Delegate efficiently and productively to junior team members in order to ensure client deliverables and performance targets are being adhered to
  • A seasoned understanding of performance digital marketing metrics for our clients with the ability to analyze performance, identify areas for improvement and justify campaign decisions to clients and internal JUICE stakeholders.
  • Have the ability to self-conduct, gather and analyze market research to determine social media opportunities and competitiveness.
  • Be an exemplary model of JUICE values

 

What you’ll need to succeed:

  • 3+ years of paid Facebook advertising experience, building high-converting funnels and driving quantifiable results.
  • 3+ years managing paid social media advertising clients
  • Strong understanding of advertising and marketing principles, particularly for online audiences.
  • Expertise in conceiving, testing, and optimizing ad copy.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills.
  • Proven ability to be proactive.
  • Ability to think critically.
  • A passion for growing businesses.

 

What you’ll find here:

  • Competitive salary based on experience level.
  • Awesome, energetic work environment.
  • Annual offsite.
  • Lunch & Learns.
  • Matching 401k plan.
  • Health benefits.
  • Unlimited PTO
  • Fully Remote Work.

results.title: Marketing Manager
results.description:
We are seeking a creative yet structured Marketing Manager to grow our marketing engine and change the way people with chronic conditions receive care. In this remote role, you will be critical in developing and running high-performing campaigns that drive qualified B2B leads, with a strong bias towards rapid iteration and experimentation. You will be responsible for creating and executing growth marketing campaigns and brand strategy across email, direct mail, paid media, sponsorships, and events to fill our sales funnel. 

Who is Better Health?

Better Health is a new type of medical provider built on peer to peer connection, helping people with chronic conditions live and age at home. We bundle peer support, education, and home delivery of medical supplies in an end-to-end digital care solution. We help our members discover and purchase the best medical equipment and supplies to address their underlying chronic conditions and receive the education and support they need to thrive at home. 

Since our inception in November 2019, Better Health has gained Medicare licenses in 46 states, 16 Medicaid licenses, and preferred national provider contracts with leading payers, including Oscar Health and Humana. This has allowed our member base to rapidly grow with virtually no churn. We are backed by Caffeinated Capital, General Catalyst, Mastry, 8VC, Bill Ackman and  a large group of experienced investors and entrepreneurs (see our series A announcement post). 

So, what will you do as our Marketing Manager?

  • Be the right-hand person to our head of marketing for everything marketing related in Better Health — you will be involved in setting the strategy, experimenting with new channels, executing programs, and measuring success
  • Develop value propositions, messaging, and go-to-market assets that drive demand with our target audiences of health insurance companies (payers), healthcare providers, and patients
  • Collaborate with internal teams on member marketing & communications, implementing campaigns across email, SMS, and direct mail
  • Develop content marketing and website presence that resonates with our prospects 
  • Ensure marketing efforts are measurable and performing. Develop and evaluate reports and extract key insights that impact our website, marketing goals, and sales funnel
  • Ensure consistent branding across the company, maintaining and disseminating style guides and asset library 
  • Manage vendors and freelancers to drive on-brand and effective marketing deliverables
  • Brainstorm with teams to develop creative solutions and growth strategies

Sounds exciting? We’re interested in YOU if this sounds like you: 

  • You like to be involved in everything so you can use your broad range of skills, from developing value propositions and writing high-impact copy, to creating growth campaigns and marketing analytics that report on success 
  • Ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously, can pivot quickly, with relentless followthrough
  • Have 3-7 years of experience in B2B marketing, at a fast-growing startup, healthcare a big plus
  • Are a proven builder of high-performing marketing campaigns and programs, with demonstrated success rolling out content marketing initiatives 
  • Ability to tell a succinct, meaningful, and actionable story with data using visualization and other techniques
  • Ability and insight to drive improvements in design, traffic, and website content.
  • Adept with aspects of digital marketing like SEO, marketing automation, and email marketing, but also know how to explore/develop new marketing channels
  • Communicative and solutions-oriented — You are the first to flag an issue and have already thought of potential solutions 
  • Outcomes driven — You focus on the end goal, reporting on the so-what and the impact, not just the activity
  • Analytical with a narrative — You think like a journalist. Excellent researcher, ask the right questions, focus on metrics, and can extract insights from data to tell a powerful story. 
  • Familiar with MixPanel, Google Analytics, LinkedIn Campaign Manager. 

Now, why choose Better Health?

For starters, our benefits include:

  • Competitive salary + equity package
  • Healthcare & Dental 
  • Flexible PTO
  • Full remote flexibility 
  • Joining a team driven to improving the lives of those living with chronic conditions

But most importantly, here at Better Health, our mission is to bring information, access, and support to people managing chronic conditions at home. Our diverse team is united by our shared values:

  • Open dialogue with radical transparency
  • Creativity to run with ideas
  • Collaboration across teams

If you're fired up at the thought of revitalizing a tired $60 billion industry and passionate about user-focused solutions, join us!

 ---

Better Health is committed to being an employer that provides not just a good place to work, but a great and inclusive place to work. To that end, we strive to recruit and maintain a workforce that meaningfully represents the diverse and culturally rich communities that we serve. At Better Health, we are committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion.

We are an equal-opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, disability status or, any other basis protected by federal, state or local law, ordinance or regulation.

results.title: Director of Product Marketing
results.description:
At Nova Credit, our mission is to power a more fair and inclusive financial system for the world. Nova Credit’s diverse global team is stitching together the world's credit data into a single network to unlock financial opportunities for immigrants and other populations historically excluded from the credit system. We’ve built a platform that enables lenders to access a single, predictive cross-border credit database to help enable underwriting decisions. We are backed by leading investors including Kleiner Perkins, General Catalyst, and Index Ventures.
 
Nova Credit works with some of the world’s preeminent firms in the credit sector. Our unique product position generates value for a diverse set of constituents, including thousands of consumers, public corporations, and various financial & technology partners globally. This privileged position creates a unique opportunity for marketing to generate significant growth opportunities through a variety of strategies by working closely with leaders across various organizations. 
 
We’re looking for a Director of Product Marketing to elevate our brand and product position into a sophisticated, enterprise-grade offering to enable our GTM function to enter hyper-growth. In this role you will fully own the strategy and execution of the entire product marketing function, focusing on building a cohesive B2B narrative for our two (and future) products, solidifying our position as leaders in our product categories, developing exceptional thought leadership, and enabling our sales and marketing campaigns with content that moves our target consumer. At the same time, you will oversee the product marketing strategy for our D2C motion, as we continue to grow our affiliate revenue and expand our existing accounts under the same Nova Credit brand.
 
This is a full-time role on the Marketing Team, reporting directly to Nova Credit’s VP of Marketing.



RESPONSIBILITIES:
  • Elevate Nova Credit’s brand and product assets to position the company as a leading, enterprise-grade financial technology provider
  • Provide strategic direction for our product marketing function as well as create a cross-functional view of marketing initiatives and campaigns
  • Maintain strong cross-functional relationships and work streams with Product, Revenue, and Engineering to execute product assets and campaigns 
  • Build exceptional thought leadership content that (1) educates our prospects/customers, (2) positions Nova Credit at the forefront of the cash flow underwriting movement, and (3) solidifies our expertise in the new-to-country credit market 
  • Own and maintain our portfolio of marketing assets, including website, landing pages, sales collateral (below), videos, and more
  • Create collateral that helps our sales team win deals, including pitch decks, one-pagers, proposal documents, use cases, case studies, email copy, and other educational materials 
  • Develop a robust framework for maintaining and democratizing product messaging and collateral 
  • Leverage product and industry expertise (via customer feedback, user research, GTM market analysis, etc.) to continuously drive customers’ product competency and usage
  • Understand our customers’ needs at a granular level, unearthing the most critical pain points, and be their voice throughout all marketing assets and campaigns
  • Lead product launches and strategic marketing efforts 
  • Routinely measure the success of assets and leverage insights to influence future GTM roadmaps 



YOUR SKILLSET:
  • Proven experience working with senior leads in a cross-functional capacity to drive projects to completion with a high degree of excellence
  • Experience building product marketing teams and managing various skill sets such as creative, content development, writing, editorial, product management, and design
  • Vision and creativity for impactful storytelling 
  • Comfortable working with B2B and D2C audiences, simultaneously
  • Strong project management skills; results-focused with impactful execution and follow-through; highly detail-oriented
  • Ability to translate highly technical B2B products into crisp customer-facing narratives with a focus on driving product education and usage 
  • Experience working with early-stage technology companies selling to different customer profiles; ideally in a fast-paced environment; fintech experience preferred
  • 8+ years of B2B product marketing experience
 
We consider all elements of compensation as a part of the value we provide to Novans. This may include base salary, equity grants, incentive compensation for eligible roles, professional development, flexible PTO, and tenure rewards. We offer U.S.-based Novans competitive, employer-subsidized medical, dental, and vision plans, in addition to mental health and wellness benefits and a range of other benefits & perks.
 
Base Salary Range for U.S.-based candidates: $175,000 - $213,000, dependent on the candidate’s individual experience, skills, education, location, and qualifications. 
 
Everyone is welcome at Nova Credit. We are an equal-opportunity employer where our diversity and inclusion are central pillars to our company strategy. We look for applicants who understand, embrace and thrive in a multicultural and increasingly globalized world. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

results.title: Director of Marketing
results.description:
Bitwave is a rapidly expanding startup that specializes in software for businesses that use digital assets and crypto. Our platform provides cryptocurrency accounting, tax tracking, bookkeeping, digital asset treasury management, crypto AR / AP tooling, and we recently added full DeFi support (lending pool, liquidity pools, NFTs, etc).

We're looking for a Director of Marketing to direct and oversee the planning, development and execution of the company's marketing and advertising initiatives. The ideal candidate for this role will have extensive background generating revenue by increasing sales through successful marketing for an organization using market research, pricing, product marketing, marketing communications, advertising and public relations (ideally in the SaaS, Fintech or crypto/DeFi space).

You will partner with senior management to define and implement a strategy for the company's overall messaging, to ensure message distribution across channels and to targeted audiences. The company and department are in their early growth stages, so it is necessary that you can balance and re-balance shifting priorities as you continue to grow the team to an ideal size.

In this role you will:

  • Contribute to the overall growth of the company by planning, implementing, and managing marketing strategy.
  • Design, plan and execute effective marketing campaigns. 
  • Plan, direct and coordinate marketing budgets in accordance with organizational goals.
  • Develop and maintain relevant KPIs for the marketing department.
  • Review and manage the company's content marketing strategy.
  • Evaluate existing market research studies and analyze the results in order to align marketing between customer preferences and the company's financial and branding goals.
  • Ensure marketing strategy takes into consideration the latest technology and best practices. 

Preferred Qualifications

  • 10+ years of experience in the marketing function, including demonstrated growth in position complexity and responsibility
  • BA/BS degree in marketing, business administration or a related field. An advanced graduate degree is a plus
  • Fintech or crypto company experience is required; strong crypto and DeFi knowledge is a plus
  • Demonstrated success and the desire to work in a tech start-up environment is required
  • Exceptional verbal, written, and visual communication skills
  • Excellent organizational skills
